messages: eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:50): Ok, so if I have <p><b></p> <p> does the space get wrapped by <b>?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:51): I'm leaning towards yes, althought the test case claims it doesn't.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:51): Also, the Python implementation agrees with me
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:51): So does the Ruby implementation
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:52): (could it be? could eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 have actually found a real test-case bug?

eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:54): It could be a spec bug, since what then happens is we stick the <p> inside the <b><i><u> tags, which is not what active formatting elements is supposed to do.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:55): Any comments?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:56): come again?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:57): (What does Validator.nu do?)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:57): Oh, yeah
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:58): V.nu does the test-case behavior
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (23:59): I guess I could figure out what they did different.

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:01): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: Henri is generally more up to date than html5lib. Although there is a case with whitespace that he preemptively changed anticipating a spec change that hasn't happened
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:02): Yep, that seems like it.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:02): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 is not reconstructing active formatting elements when there's whitespace
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:03): The spec hasn't changed w.r.t. yet, though
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:04): I thought tokenizing/treebuilding was pretty stable now?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:08): "Update the tree building tests with frameset-ok, new AAA and (not yet in spec) WebKit-style foster-parenting"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:08): if something depends on whitespace in 'in body', it's likely a bug
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:08): So it's the webkit thing again :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:08): oh, you meant foster parenting
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:08): that's deliberate
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:09): So, I understand that the spec may not be at the point that V.nu is
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:09): But having tests that the spec deliberately fails really doesn't help me out, if I'm trying for 0 fails
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:09): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: when I checked that in, Hixie's IRC statements hinted at spec going that way
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:10): Anyway, it's whitespace "in body"
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:11): Specifically, the difference is V.nu checks if a character token is whitespace, and if it is, doesn't reconstruct active formatting elements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:11): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: not while foster parenting?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:11): Nope.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:11): No foster parenting at all.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:11): You changed the test case, however, in commit 535a1040e2df
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:12): for which I just posted the summary
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:12): wait, have the test cases moved to hg?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:12): I've been checking in to svn still
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:13): Does Google Code magically transfer it?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:14): I mean, there's no way to tell if there was an svn repository from Google Code website anymore
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:14): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: Dunno. I had to do the initial migration manually though
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:14): Oh hey, that's the last commit you made, according to mercurial
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:15): When did the migration occur?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:15): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: you'll save a lot of EOF grief if you get my changes from this week from svn
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:16): But I don't even remember where the svn repository *is*
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:16): I don't either. I'm not on the computer that has my html5lib sandbox
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:17): Anyway, not turning off access to the subversion repos seems... poor.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:17): I'm not sure how we can easily merge your changes back in.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:17): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: https://html5lib.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:17): Awesome
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:17): It seems like svn should become read-only
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:19): (I mean ideally, not that it does)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:21): AWesome, we only lost one commit
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:21): (maybe two, if one of those was in a branch)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: you can probably take its diff and apply to the new hg repository
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:22): I haven't committed to branches
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:22): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: I'll do that when I get to my work computer
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:23): Odd. 1303 has nothing in it
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:23): Great.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:24): Holy crap that's a big change
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:25): Oh, these are all tokenizer updates
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:25): Hmm... we already pass all of the tests... uh oh
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:25): Anyway, b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, you maintain that Hixie is going to change the spec to follow V.nu behavior?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:28): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: I intend to keep pushing Hixie that way :-)
d8441a460e8ac10414418e8e2c673ec3 (00:28): ...huh.  The <header> tag has changed functionality?
d8441a460e8ac10414418e8e2c673ec3 (00:28): catches up on the blog reading
d8441a460e8ac10414418e8e2c673ec3 (00:28): ...am I really only allowed to use <header> with <h#>?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:28): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: the tokenizer changed to discard tag token if EOF happens inside tag
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:28): Ok. Do you mind if I separate out that test to its own file?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:29): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: that would be good
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:33): d8441a460e8ac10414418e8e2c673ec3: You can only use <hgroup> with <hx> <header> you can use with anything
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:33): Done.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:33): I should document this somewhere
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I assume test 44 is another one of those?
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:39): (in tests2.dat)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:40): This one is <p><b><i><u></p>\n<p>X
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:41): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: if that one deviates from spec, it's a bug
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:43): It's the same thing (note that in my post \n was meant to be interpreted as an scape)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:43): wonders how to stop hg merge from merging the python3 directory into the python directory
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:43): V.nu doesn't reconstruct active formatting elements on \n; everyone else does
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:43): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: sounds like a bug in V.nu
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:43): You could ask #mercurial about it
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:43): But... \n is whitespace
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:44): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: I need to study what code I have written
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:45): thinks "Wow, it's not often I get three reference implementations :-)"
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:47): THIRTY-SIX!
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:47): (failures, that is)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:49): Ok, now I need to implement the fragment algorithm
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:58): I think that's enough html5lib hacking for today
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:58): Test suites 1-3 are now passing
